item.title: Advanced Digital Imaging Spring Exhibition Opening Reception to be held April 8
item.description: The opening reception of Advanced Digital Imaging Spring 2025 Exhibition is on Tuesday April 8, 6 to 7pm in SAGE Lab 5th floor Dean’s Gallery. The exhibition consists of works-in-progress and short study projects created in class in response to studies in gesture, emotion, the human body, virtual and augmented realities, and expanded notions of perception and time. Included in the exhibition are multimedia, photography, archival digital and hand drawn works on paper, canvas, and other materials.

item.title: “Create Reproducible R Environments with renv!” RPIrates Monthly Meeting (Weds, 02 Apr, 6p, AE217)
item.description: RPI R users are invited to the April 2025 meeting of RPIrates: The RPI R Users Group! Our topic for Weds, 02 Apr (6p, AE217) will be “Create Reproducible R Environments with renv!,” led by Dr. John S. Erickson, Director of Research Operations of the Future of Computing Institute (FOCI) at Rensselaer and Chief Instigator of RPIrates. In this session we’ll learn how R’s renv package can be used to create reproducible R environments that are more isolated, portable and reproducible.

item.title: Computer Science Colloquia: Utkarsh Ojha - On the creative potential of generative models and detecting their images | March 31
item.description: Date: Monday, March 31, 2025 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM in CII 3206 - Utkarsh Ojha is currently a postdoctoral fellow at Carnegie Mellon University. He received his Ph.D. in computer science from the University of Wisconsin-Madison. His research work has centered around generative models for images. He has developed algorithms that can enable those models to create new visual concepts not seen during training. As of late, his research focus has shifted to developing methods which can distinguish real and AI-generated images.

item.title: RPI Orchestra and ESYO, Side by Side: 2025 Spring Concert to be Held April 5
item.description: Celebrate the collaboration between the Rensselaer Orchestra and the Empire State Youth Orchestra as they perform side-by-side April 5th at 2pm in EMPAC Concert Hall. This spring program includes the breathtaking ‘Elysium’ by Samy Moussa, the famous ‘Symphonie Fantastique’ by Hector Berlioz, and the evocative Oboe Concerto by Thomas L. Read, featuring 2024 Rensselaer Concerto Competition winner Gianna Scire, ’25 as soloist.

item.title: Computer Science Colloquia: Sheshera Mysore - Supporting Knowledge Workflows by Learning from Interactions | April 2
item.description: Date: Wednesday, April 2, 2025 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM, Ricketts 211 - Sheshera Mysore is a postdoctoral researcher at Microsoft in the Office of Applied Research. In May 2024, he earned a Ph.D. in computer science from the University of Massachusetts Amherst. His research lies at the intersection of Natural Language Processing, Information Retrieval, and Human-Computer Interaction. His work has been published in venues such as EMNLP, NAACL, ACL, NeurIPS Datasets & Benchmarks, SIGIR, RecSys, and CHIIR.

item.title: Curious About RPI’s Finances and Resources?
item.description: Ever wondered how RPI’s institutional revenues break down? Or how our endowment is managed and invested? How about the size of our workforce—how many staff and faculty make up the RPI community? And how are resources allocated, assessed, and planned over time? For all these details and more, dive into Standard 6 of RPI’s Self-Study for Middle States Accreditation, a team led by Ms. Kelli Perry and Ms. Sue Proskine.
